description.narrative: Country Programme is effectively supported and coordinated., which contributes to Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Supply And Logistics. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The country programme is effectively designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality standards in achieving results for children.

sector.narrative: CO/RO Supply - technical assistance and collaboration in supply chain, procurement of goods and services, and logistics

title.narrative: Burundi United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Burundi 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Country Programme is effectively supported and coordinated.

description.narrative: In 2019, considering the complex humanitarian and development context in Burundi, coordination was required on both fronts while UNICEF continued to work closely with partners to better define resilience programming. Thematic areas of early childhood development, adolescent skills agenda and resilience programming provided a platform for more enhanced collaboration across UNICEF sectors. Programme coordination actively engaged with humanitarian and development partners, including donors, for more strategic alignment of objectives and efforts for results. A series of training on RBM, HACT and PSEA boosted the team's capacity as well as the capacity of partners. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2019

title.narrative: Availability of multisectoral thematic concept notes
Workplan is timely signed by the Government of Burundi
